Ingredients: all-purpose flour:2 cups,granulated sugar:1/2 cup,baking powder:2 and 1/2 teaspoons,dried culinary lavender:2 teaspoons,lemon zest:2 teaspoons,salt:1/2 teaspoon,unsalted butter (frozen):1/2 cup (1 stick),buttermilk:1/2 cup,eggs:1 large egg,pure vanilla extract:1 and 1/2 teaspoons,
Instructions: 1: Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, lavender, lemon zest, and salt together in a large bowl. Grate the frozen butter using a box grater. Add it to the flour mixture and combine with a pastry cutter, two forks, or your fingers until the mixture comes together in pea-sized crumbs. Place in the refrigerator or freezer as you mix the wet ingredients together.;2: Whisk 1/2 cup buttermilk, the egg, and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. Drizzle over the flour mixture, then mix together until everything appears moistened.;3: Pour onto the counter and, with floured hands, work dough into a ball as best you can. Dough will be sticky. If it’s too sticky, add a little more flour. If it seems too dry, add 1 more Tablespoon buttermilk. Press into an 8-inch disc and, with a sharp knife or bench scraper, cut into 8 wedges. For smaller scones, press dough into two 5-inch discs and cut each into 8 wedges.;4: Brush scones with remaining buttermilk and for extra crunch, sprinkle with coarse sugar. (You can do this before or after refrigerating in the next step.);5: Place scones on a plate or lined baking sheet (if your fridge has space!) and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 400°F (204°C).;7: Bake for 18-26 minutes or until golden brown around the edges and lightly browned on top. Larger scones take closer to 25 minutes.

Ingredients: unsalted butter:3 tablespoons,flour:2 tablespoons,canned evaporated milk:1 12oz can,half and half:1 cup,onion powder:1 tablespoon,garlic powder:2 teaspoons,creole seasoning:1 teaspoon,cayenne pepper:1/4 teaspoon,grated mozzarella cheese:1/2 cup,grated sharp cheddar cheese:1/2 cup,jack cheese:1/2 cup,Salt and pepper:to taste,uncooked macaroni:8 ounces,
Instructions: 1: Add butter to skillet, as soon as butter melts whisk in flour. Continue whisking until flour is fully mixed with butter. Then cook for about a minute to get rid of the flour taste.;2: Slowly add evaporated milk a little at the time, followed by the half and half. you do not want the mixture to form any lumps. Simmer for about 3-5 minutes until mixture thickens slightly.;3: Add seasonings, onion and garlic powder, creole seasoning and cayenne pepper.;4: Bring to a simmer and let it simmer gently for about 2 minutes.;5: Stir in the cheeses (reserve some as toppings later), and continue stirring until everything’s melted and evenly combined and smooth. Salt & pepper, to taste.;6: Bake at 375 Degrees F° for 20 minutes or until golden and bubbly.

Ingredients: fresh uncooked sweet corn husked and cut from cob:4 1/2 cups (6 ears),diced red onion:1 cup,diced avocado:1 large avocado,lime juice:1 lime or about 3 Tablespoons,chopped fresh basil:1/4 cup,sea salt:1 teaspoon,Ground pepper: to taste,
Instructions: 1: After husking and cutting corn from the cob, pull out as many corn silks as possible. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.;2: Serve immediately or allow it to marinate for a few hours.

Ingredients: extra-virgin olive oil:2 tablespoons,diced yellow onion:1 medium onion,diced celery:1 large celery rib,diced carrots:1 large carrot,minced garlic:4 large cloves,peeled and chopped potatoes:1 large baking potato,red lentils:1.5 cups,vegetable broth:2 quarts,ground cumin:2 teaspoons,smoked paprika:1 teaspoon,ancho chili powder:1/2 teaspoon,ground black pepper:1/2 teaspoon,cayenne pepper:1/4 teaspoon,turmeric:1/4 teaspoon,freshly squeezed lemon juice:2 tablespoons,
Instructions: 1: Heat a large saucepan or small stockpot over medium to medium-high heat. Once hot, add the oil. When oil starts to shimmer, stir in the onion, celery, and carrot. Cook for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in garlic and cook for 2 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Add the potato, lentils, and vegetable broth. Turn up heat to medium-high and bring to a boil. Then turn heat down to medium-low and stir in cumin, ancho chili powder, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and turmeric. Cover and simmer until all the vegetables are very tender, about 40 to 50 minutes.;2: Using an immersion blender, carefully puree the soup right in the pot, until no chunks of vegetables remain. Or carefully transfer hot soup, in batches, to a blender to blend until smooth - and then return the soup back to the pot. Stir in lemon juice. Taste test and season with salt, if needed.

Ingredients: plain/all-purpose flour:2 cups,baking powder:1 teaspoon,baking soda:1/2 teaspoon,cornflour/cornstarch:2 teaspoons,salt:1/4 teaspoon,melted unsalted butter:1/2 cup,caster/granulated sugar:1/2 cup,light brown sugar:1/4 cup,room-temperature egg:1 large egg,vanilla extract:2 teaspoons,smooth peanut butter:1/2 cup,chocolate chips:1 cup,
Instructions:
1: Scoop out 16 teaspoons of peanut butter, and place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Freeze until solid - at least 1 hour.;2: Preheat the oven to 350F, and line a baking tray with parchment paper, or a silicone mat. Set aside.;3: Whisk together the flour, baking powder, cornflour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside."
Caesar Salad"
column4: lettuce:3 cups,croutons:1/4 cup,shredded parmesean cheese:1/8 cup,caesar dressing:1/8 cup,
column5: 1: combine lettuce, croutons, and dressing in a large bowl and toss;2: sprinkle with parmesean cheese and serve immediately

Ingredients: sourdough bread:2 slices,american cheese:1 slice,shredded cheddar cheese:1/4 cup,butter:1 tbsp,
Instructions: 1: heat a skillet on medium heat. butter one side of each slice of bread and place the first slice butter-side down on the skillet.;2: add the american cheese and cheddar cheese to the top of the bread and place the other slice of bread on top so that the buttered side is facing up.;3: after about 3 minutes, flip the sandwich to toast the other side. once cheese is melted, remove from skillet and serve immediately.
